result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Warrant canceled - Spoke to Sam from dispatch
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

1:05 PM Defendant GREGORY F ANDERSON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on address and employment.  ADA McElroy goes over the defendant's criminal history and makes bond recommendation. Statement by the defendant. Further statement by ADA McElroy Court orders bond at $1,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court quashes warrant.

Court schedules initial appearance for November 8, 2022 at 9:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:10 PM.

9:35 AM Defendant GREGORY F ANDERSON not in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders a warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 9:36 AM
